isis.stitle: TSI 97-12-11R - Supplemental Cooling Additive (SCA) Factory Fill and Maintenance Level of Concentration for International Engines

subjectgroup.subject: Supplemental Cooling Additive (SCA) Factory Fill and Maintenance Level of Concentration for International Engines

lev1.title: SUPPLEMENTAL COOLANT ADDITIVE
lev1.para: This TSI applies to all models with International diesel engines.

Water filters on International diesel engines are now pre-charged with 4.0 units of DCA4 supplemental coolant additive (SCA). This replaces a plain coolant filter without any SCA pre-charge. This ensures a factory level of 1.9 units per gallon (UPG). Immediately after filling, SCA will begin coating the coolant system, initializing engine and coolant system protection. The coating process will deplete a small amount of the factory installed SCA. The current specification for SCA is 1.5 to 3.0 UPG while the optimum level is 1.5 to 2.0 UPG. The pre-charged filter will provide a cushion to assure that each vehicle is delivered with the SCA level in the optimum range.

svcprocinfo.para: It is recommended that SCA concentration level be checked at regular PM service intervals. SCA levels should not exceed 3.0 UPG. During coolant system SCA maintenance, the upper level should be based on depletion rates experienced with the PM intervals utilized. Again, the optimum level is 1.5-2.0 UPG to both prevent cavitation erosion and to realize maximum cooling system component life and cooling system efficiency.

note.para: Ethylene glycol antifreeze is installed at the assembly plants. The DCA4 test kit will accurately measure DCA4 or Pencool SCA level in either ethylene glycol or propylene glycol coolant mixtures or combinations of both. Navistar does not recommend mixing ethylene glycol and propylene glycol coolants.

svcsubproc.title: Pre-Delivery
svcsubproc.para: It is not necessary or recommended to check SCA level at Pre-delivery. The only exception is if the coolant level is low from a system leak. In this case only, the SCA level should be checked and if the concentration level is found to be below 1.5 UPG, SCA should be added to bring it up to 1.9 UPG, equivalent to factory fill level.
Bus body companies and others who open and connect into International chassis cooling systems are responsible to ensure that all coolant added to the system is no less than 1.9 UPG.

svcsubproc.title: Summary
svcsubproc.para: Navistar now ships all International engines with a 4.0 unit pre-charge filter. The optimum level is 1.5-2.0 UPG. Factory fills will be a minimum of 1.9 to accommodate normal initial depletion. Only vehicles that have experienced cooling system leaks require checks at Pre-delivery inspection.
A worksheet ( Figure 1) is included to determine the amount of SCA that needs to be added to the coolant system to reach the desired level of concentration.
